Roll Modifier Option Select the modifier option to use when clicking a dice roll icon on the character sheet. Chat Roll Display Select how rolls are display in chat window. Private Skill Levels deprecated will default to private, since it doesn't work with rolltemplates. Basic Speed Button Option Select how the basic speed button is displayed in chat window. Enter unspent points If checked, show text box for unspent points. If unchecked, unspent points is calculated from Total Points text box. Use malfunction If checked, rolltable will check for malfunction. Damage Dice Icon Select icon to use for damage dice. Attribute Modifications Select option on how to apply modifications to attributes. Critical Successes Select option to determine critical success on a skill roll on rolltemplates. Show Minimum Damage Type Notes If checked, minimum damage type notes will be added to the damage roll table. Show Damage Type Notes If checked, damage type notes will be added to the damage roll table. Damage Type Note Special Enter notes for Special damage type. Penalty for each spell ON Enter a negative integer for the penalty. Penalty for each spell MAINTAINED Enter a negative integer for the penalty. Show casting details on roll template: If checked, detailed notes like casting time, duration, cost, maintain, resisted by, and class will be shown on the roll results template. Fragmentation Recoil Recoil for Fragmentation Damage. Point Summary Layout Select option on how to display the Point Summary Table. Show Original Techniques Table If checked, original techniques table will be visible. Show Revised Techniques Table If checked, revised techniques table will be visible. Show RAW Notes If checked, show Rules as Written (RAW) for Active Defense success/fail notes. Sheet Style Select a visual style for the character sheet.

Targeting Systems

Acc Accuracy
Elevation Elevation. If you're above the target, enter a positive number of hexes. If you're below the target, enter a negative number of hexes. See B407.
Range/Speed Enter the range of target and factor in relative speed if target crosses path of shooter. See B372.
Aim Bonus Each turn after the initial aim, you get an additional bonus. See B364
RoF Rate of Fire
The maximum number of shots that can be fired in
one turn (by a regular person).
The minimum number of shots is 1.

!: minimum RoF is 1/4 of the maximum, rounded up.
mxn: fires the first number of shots, which each then
split into the second number (eg. shotguns)
Jet: shoots a continuous stream of fluid. See page 106.
Scope Each turn after the initial aim, you get an additional bonus up to the scope's bonus.
Fixed scopes, aim at least as many turns as the scope's bonus.
See B412
Vehicle Targeting Vehicle targeting system bonus if shooter took time to aim. See B469
Laser Sight: +1 Laser sight gives +1 to hit.NOTE: If target can see aiming dot, they got +1 dodge! See B412
Total Combined totals from all targeting systems can't exceed weapon's base Accuracy. See B364

The modifier is applied AFTER location, grapple, shield, chinks in armor have been applied.

GURPS Character Sheet Version:

  • Combat Ranged tab. Updated the Range Calculator tool so you don't have to check the sheet option Use Ranged Attack Modifier Tool. If you click the Apply button for the Range Calculator tool, it will apply the modifiers and you will see them on the results table.
  • Traits Tab. Increased the size of the notes text boxes for Advantages, Disadvantages, and Racial Traits.
  • Active Defenses. When adding a brand new active defense, the Combat Reflexes bonus is now applied to the final base skill instead of adding a modifier bonus. Missed feature when converting Combat Reflexes in Version 2.7.8.
  • Active Defenses. Added the option to Dodge or Current Dodge as a link type.

Thresh
Fright Check Threshold - Uses Rule of 14 (B360). By default this value is 13.
This means that a roll of 14 or more is automatically a failure.
This Threshold can be modifier by the Perks of Brave (Dungeon Fantasy 11, p11) or Rule of 15
(Power Ups 2, p13).
Will and/or Fright plus bonuses (like Fearlessness or Combat Reflexes) must total 14+ for this
to be useful, of course!
Note: A Fright Check can be used for Awe and Confusion. (Powers p84 under Terror) and the Awe and
Confusion Check Table for failures. (Powers p85).
Fright Check
Unstun
Recover from physical stun, based on Health.
Roll at the end of your turn after Do Nothing
 
K Down
Knockdown and Stunning check (B420), based on HT (Health).
Roll immediately whenever the following happens:
  • You suffer a Major Wound (B420) - This is any single injury that inflicts a wound in excess of ½ your HP.
  • You suffer any Crippling Injury (B420-421).
  • Whenever you are struck in the Head (Skull, Face, or Eye) or Vitals for enough injury to cause a Shock (B419) penalty.
Modifiers:
  • - 5 for a Major Wound (B420) to the Face or Vitals (or to the Groin on a humanoid male).
  • - 10 for a Major Wound (B420) to the Skull or Eye.

Max HP
Hit Points - Based on Strength - pts/level
Cost reduced by -10% per SM+1 (B15)
Current HP
Current Hit Points
When your HP is low, you take penalties. (B419)
Reeling: If your HP is less than
- Halve Move and Dodge (round up) (B419)
- These effects are cumulative with FP loss. See GURPS FAQ: 3.4.5.7
- Note: This sheet automatically calculates that for you and adjusts those values.
Verge of Collapse
- Roll every turn @{VS} HT or fall unconscious.
- Your HT roll is at -1 for every 1xHP you are below 0.
- If you do nothing, and don't defend, you don't have to roll.
Verge of Death
- Roll once @{VS} HT to stay alive.
- If you fail by 1 or 2 you are mortally wounded, but not dead. (B423)
- Roll again every time you take injury that puts you below
another multiple of your max HP.
Death
- You are dead.
Total Destruction
- Your body has been destroyed beyond recognition or resurrection.
½ Move
Move and Dodge is halved due to hit point loss. See B419.
¼ Move
Move and Dodge is quartered due to hit point and fatigue loss. See B419.
Max FP
Fatigue Points
Based on Health
3pts/level
Current FP
Current Fatigue Points
When your FP is low you take penalties. (B426)
Tired: If your FP is less than
- Halve your Move, Dodge, and ST (round up) (B426)
- These effects are cumulative with HP loss. See GURPS FAQ: 3.4.5.7
- Note: This sheet automatically calculates that for you and adjusts
those values – This does not affect ST-based quantities,
such as HP and damage. (B426)
Verge of Collapse
- If you suffer further fatigue, each FP you lose also causes 1 HP of injury. (B426)
- Roll against Will to do anything besides rest or talk.
- If you fail your Will roll, you fall unconscious.
- On a critical failure, roll @{VS} HT or suffer a heart attack.
Unconscious: When your FP is
- Immediately fall unconscious
- FP can't drop any lower, but you still lose HP.
- You regain consciousness at 0 FP
½ MV/ST
Move, Dodge, and ST are halved due to fatigue loss. See B426.
Affects ST roll and using weapons with minimum ST.
½ ST
ST is halved due to fatigue loss. See B426.
Affects ST roll and using weapons with minimum ST.

Turning and Velocity Modifiers
Movement
Select movement type to determine turning radius and/or deceleration penalty.
Start Vel.
Enter velocity (yards/second) for current turn.
Important: Be sure to check your max allowed velocity based on movement type.
Change
Amount to accelerate or decelerate for the turn.
Final Vel.
Final velocity. Current Velocity - Deceleration.
The final velocity is how you start the turn and is used to
calculate the deceleration penalty, turn radius, and tight turn penalty.
Decel. Pen.
Deceleration Skill penalty to DX roll or operation skill.
Example: Moving 12/second, need to slow to 5/second, deceleration = 12 - 5 = 7.
Can safely decelerate up to base move, no roll needed.
If over safe deceleration, then make DX+3. If in vehicle, use operation skill + handling statistic.
Apply the appropriate skill penalty from the input forms to the right.
How it works: -1 per two full yards/second beyond Basic Move by which you cut your speed.
NOTE: make an additional roll if you're also turning.
Example: Car with move 3/57 traveling at 16 yards/second, needs to decelerate to 6 yards/second.
Driving Skill: 12, Handling: 0.
Total Deceleration = 16 - 6 = 10.
Can safely decelerate to 16 - 3 (base move) = 13.
Penalty = 13 - 6 (goal speed) / 2 = -3.
Making Driving Skill 12 - 3 to succeed.
see B395.
Turn Radius
Turn Radius. Minimum number of hexes to move before making a 60° facing change.
Turn Radius = (Final Velocity / Base Move Score) rounded down.
Example: Super Run = 6/24. Final Velocity = 18. Turn Radius = 18/6 = 3.
See B394.
Tight Turn
Tight Turn Skill Penalty. Allows you to make an additional facing change.
120° facing change instead of 60°.
Penalty = -1 per full increment of base move which your velocity exceeds your Basic Move.
See B395.

1st column will show your modifier based on the entries for the 2nd and 3rd columns.

Point Sum
Total: Manual input: Represents total value of the
PC in Character Points (spent & unspent combined).
Spent: Automatic total of Spent points:
Attributes + Traits + Skills + Other.
Unspent: Has the option of being Manual or
Automatic, depending on an option selected on the
Settings page entitled ‘Enter Unspent Points’.
Manual Mode (Blue color): You manually enter your
Unspent points.
Automatic mode (Black color): It calculates the
point total difference between Total and Spent.

Total: Manual input: Represents total value of the
PC in Character Points (spent and unspent combined).

Success Note:
Critical Success Note:
Fail Note:
Critical Fail Note:
SM
Size Modifier of target.
HP
Current Hit Points
When your HP is low, you take penalties. (B419)
Reeling: If your HP is less than
- Halve Move and Dodge (round up) (B419)
- These effects are cumulative with FP loss. See GURPS FAQ: 3.4.5.7
- Note: This sheet automatically calculates that for you and adjusts those values.
Verge of Collapse
- Roll every turn @{VS} HT or fall unconscious.
- Your HT roll is at -1 for every 1xHP you are below 0.
- If you do nothing, and don't defend, you don't have to roll.
Verge of Death
- Roll once @{VS} HT to stay alive.
- If you fail by 1 or 2 you are mortally wounded, but not dead. (B423)
- Roll again every time you take injury that puts you below
another multiple of your max HP.
Death
- You are dead.
Total Destruction
- Your body has been destroyed beyond recognition or resurrection.
Max HP
Hit Points - Based on Strength - 2pts/level
Cost reduced by -10% per SM+1 (B15)
MAJ
Major wound threshold. Any single injury of greater than 1/2 your HP. If using hit location, any injury that disables a limb is a Major Wound.
Roll HT to avoid Knockdown and Stunning or use the K Down trait on the general tab. See B420.
Enc
Current encumbrance level. Penalty equal to your encumbrance is applied to Dodge, Judo, Karate, or any fencing Parry. See B549
Load
Amount of weight you're currently carrying.
Move
Note: The Move score automatically adjusts for Encumbrance
and for HP and/or FP loss below 1/3. (B419, B426)
ENH MOVE
Enhanced ground move.
STEP: The number in parentheses is the step distance.
Air
Air/Flying move.
STEP: The number in parentheses is the step distance.
Water
Water/Swimming move.
STEP: The number in parentheses is the step distance.
Dodge
Note: The Dodge score automatically adjusts for Encumbrance
and for HP and/or FP loss below 1/3. (B419, B426)
Thrust
Thrust damage based on Striking ST. You can use the macro name in a weapons damage column and apply basic math. Example: Damage = @{thrust}+1
Swing
Swing damage based on Striking ST. You can use the macro name in a weapons damage column and apply basic math. Example: Damage = @{swing}+1

Hit Location & Armor Table

Template:
Select the hit location type and click the Apply button.
ALERT: This will delete the current hit locations!
Flexible Armor
Flexible Armor If damage fails to penetrate DR, victim suffers blunt trauma.
Cutting, impaling, piercing does 1 HP per full 10 HP damage.
Crushing damage does 5 HP per full 5 HP damage.
If layered armor, only damage that penetrates outer layer inflicts blunt trauma. B379
 
Layers:
Select the number of armor layers to display.
Notes:
Enter notes and traits here.
Example include adding damage ntoes for Unliving, Homogenous, Diffuse, Unbreakable Bones (Powers 52), Damage Reduction (Powers 52). see B380.

 

Location

 

Pen
Penalty to hit this location.
NOTE: Size Modifier is factored in on Applying location type or changing Size Modifier.
Layer 1
Enter DR for this location.
* = flexible
You can split the DR using with these suggested abbreviations.
cr = crush
pi = pierce
cut = cutting
imp = impaling
bu = burning
Alert: To enter a split DR, the first number must be the primary DR, while the second number are the exceptions, this is required in order to know how to split the armor.
"Layer 1 (Inner most) is good for natural DR or concealable armor, such as cloth armor under a breastplate.
Front
Back
Layer 2
Enter DR for this location.
* = flexible
You can split the DR using with these suggested abbreviations.
cr = crush
pi = pierce
cut = cutting
imp = impaling
bu = burning
Alert: To enter a split DR, the first number must be the primary DR, while the second number are the exceptions, this is required in order to know how to split the armor.
Layer 2 is good for your primary armor, like helmet, leather armor, gloves, etc.
Front
Back
Layer 3
Enter DR for this location.
* = flexible
You can split the DR using with these suggested abbreviations.
cr = crush
pi = pierce
cut = cutting
imp = impaling
bu = burning
Alert: To enter a split DR, the first number must be the primary DR, while the second number are the exceptions, this is required in order to know how to split the armor.
Layer 3 is good for force shields, magic DR, etc.
Front
Back
Layer 4
Enter DR for this location.
* = flexible
You can split the DR using with these suggested abbreviations.
cr = crush
pi = pierce
cut = cutting
imp = impaling
bu = burning
Alert: To enter a split DR, the first number must be the primary DR, while the second number are the exceptions, this is required in order to know how to split the armor.
Layer 4 (Outer most) is also good for force shields, magic DR, etc.
Back
Summary
This sums up each layer, from layer 1 (inner) to layer 4 (outer).
* = flexible armor.
Alert: Only one layer per row may have split armor.
Front
Back

 

DB
Apply the defense bonus of a shield, cloak, spell (B252), or Meta-trait (Supers34). See B374
Shield/Cloak: Used against attacks from front or from your shield side. Can't be used against firearms unless you're using the Damage to Shields option.
Shield Spell: Protects from frontal attacks and is cumulative with a normal shield.

 

DMG
Enter the amount of damage this location has taken.
NOTE: The damage will note affect the current Hit Points.

 

Div
Hit Point Divisor. If the number is 2 or higher, that means the location can be disabled and a value will be updated in the next column. See B421.

 

DIS
Disabled/Crippled Threshold.
If a single injury meets or exceeds this value, the extremity or structure is disabled.
NOTE: In most cases, if disabled/crippled in one injury, the excess damage is lost, except where noted, such as the eyes.
Dismemberment: If injury is twice the threshold, then extremity is destroyed. Cutting or Explosion will sever the limb.
See B421

 

Wounds
Enter individual wounds here, if limb is crippled, bleeding, etc.
Example: -6 pi (major wound), -2 burn.

New Hit Locations

Where
Pen
This is the Penalty
applied to attack the
specific location.
DR
Low-Tech #/# usually means All Attack Types / Except
this specific Type of attack.
Example: Enter as 3/2cr* means DR3 vs all attacks
except cr which uses DR2. * means it is Flexible
armor (B379).
High-Tech and Ultra-Tech #/# usually mean against
these Type Attacks / All other Attack Types.
Example: Enter as 5imp, cr /2 means DR5 vs imp and
cr type of attacks and DR2 against all other types
of attacks.

Critical Fail Note:
Knockback save vs crushing or cutting attacks
A crushing attack can cause knockback regardless of whether it penetrates DR.
A cutting attack can cause knockback only if it fails to penetrate DR.
For every full ST-2 damage (BEFORE subtracting DR) target is moved yard away from attacker.
NOTE: If target has no ST score (like a wall) or is not resisting, use HP instead.

If knocked back, Roll against DX, Acrobatics, or Judo.
-1 per yard of knockback AFTER the first yard.
+4 for Perfect Balance. see B378.
If target collides with an object, use yards knocked back to calculate Collisions and Falls (see Combat Tools).
1 yard per points

Acc
RNG
Range. See B269.
RoF
Rate of Fire
The maximum number of shots that can be fired in
one turn (by a regular person).
The minimum number of shots is 1.

!: minimum RoF is 1/4 of the maximum, rounded up.
mxn: fires the first number of shots, which each then
split into the second number (eg. shotguns)
Jet: shoots a continuous stream of fluid. See page 106.
Shots
The number of shots that can be fired before the
weapon must be reloaded.
The parenthetical number indicates the number of 1
second ready maneuvers required to reload the
weapon.
T: the weapon is thrown. To "reload" it, pick it up.
i: you must load the shots individually. the listed
time is for each shot.
Bulk
Move and Attack: If you are making a ranged attack,
you have a penalty of -2 or the weapon’s Bulk rating,
whichever is worse (B365, B469, B548).
Close Combat: If using a ranged weapon, ignore the usual
speed/range penalty and apply the weapon’s Bulk
statistic as a penalty to hit. B391
It also serves as a penalty to Holdout skill when you
attempt to conceal the weapon. B370
RCL
When firing at RoF 2+, every full multiple of Rcl
by which you make your attack roll means you score
one extra hit, to a maximum number of hits equal
to total shots fired. See page 373.

Malfunction
Malfunction is an Optional Rule. B278, B279, B382, tables B407 & HT179, with more detailed info HT79-81. If the option Use Malfunction is
checked [see Sheet Options page], and if the # entered here is greater than 0, then the roll result will check for weapon malfunction.
Malfunction has "priority" over a critical miss: if both would occur, only the malfunction takes place. See Critical Misses B382.
...Verify
If Verify is checked, then roll again to verify the malfunction. see HT79
Very Reliable
Some weapons, according to High Tech (HT101, 121, 157) are Very Reliable. Check this box if this weapon is.
(Optional: See Settings TAB, Use Malfunction)
Armor Divisor:
Divide the target's armor DR by this number before subtracting damage
or (adding it adding it to the HT roll for an affliction). See B268.
Explosive attacks (optional house rule: area effect attacks) only apply divisor to target of direct hit. See B269.
Afflictions divide the armor DR before determining bonus to HT roll. See B269

RoF
Rate of Fire
The maximum number of shots that can be fired in
one turn (by a regular person).
The minimum number of shots is 1.

!: minimum RoF is 1/4 of the maximum, rounded up.
mxn: fires the first number of shots, which each then
split into the second number (eg. shotguns)
Jet: shoots a continuous stream of fluid. See page 106.
Shots
The number of shots that can be fired before the
weapon must be reloaded.
The parenthetical number indicates the number of 1
second ready maneuvers required to reload the
weapon.
T: the weapon is thrown. To "reload" it, pick it up.
i: you must load the shots individually. the listed
time is for each shot.
RCL
When firing at RoF 2+, every full multiple of Rcl
by which you make your attack roll means you score
one extra hit, to a maximum number of hits equal
to total shots fired. See page 373.

Multi
Damage Multiplier:
Enter the number to multiply 6d6 by.
An explosion doing 6dxn damage takes (nxn)/4 pounds of TNT.
NOTE: Anyone caught in a blast may attempt an active defense
roll to dive for cover from the explosion’s collateral damage and
fragmentation; see Dodge and Drop B377.
Rad
Radius of collateral damage. See B414
For instance, if an explosion does 6dx2 damage,
everyone within 24 yards is vulnerable.

For fragmentation damage, the radius is
5 x dice of fragmentation damage.
Div
Divisor. Amount to divide damage by based on
distance from blast. See B414
You can enter: 3 (default), 2, or 1.
Default: Damage rolled / (3 x distance blast).
Damage Modifiers Explosion, see B104.
Exp. +100% = Damage rolled / (2 x distance from blast).
Exp. +150% = Damage rolled / (1 x distance from blast).
TGT
Target's distance from center of blast.
Damage / (3 x distance from blast). Round down.

Fragmentation
Fragmentation damage.

Skill
Base skill level for a fragmentation damage to hit a target.
A hit is automatic if the explosive attack actually strikes the target.
Only three modifiers apply: the range modifier for the distance from the center
of the blast to the target, the modifier for the target’s posture (prone, etc.),
and the target’s Size Modifier. It is possible for several fragments to hit! For
every three points by which the attack roll succeeds, one additional fragment
strikes the target.

Gravity:
Standard gravity is based on 1G, earth normal.
If gravity is over 1G, then add your weight and encumberance then multiply by Gravity - 1. Add this value to your encumbrance.
If gravity is less than 1G, multiply the weight of your gear by the Gravity value, this is your new encumbrance.
See B350.

Latest Changes: Updated

Point Summary

One of the most commented part about this character sheet is the Point Summary which does not correspond to GCA4 nor GCS, and for that matter - any manual process. Because of this, we have made a major change to the way the Point Summary totals are shown on the General page. This is to take make it much easier for users of GCA4 and GCS to compare the points allocated in GCA4 /GCS to their input into this sheet. To take advantage of these changes you will have to make some manual changes to your existing PCs.

Under Traits:

  • Copy/Paste your current Perks that you have under Advantages and Quirks under Disadvantages, to their newly created Repeating Sections respectively.
  • Verify/Create or Copy/Paste your Racial Traits to its associate Repeating Section if you haven’t already.
  • Appearance has been moved to the Bio/Misc page. The drop down is still there BUT the points have been removed. You need to manually enter those points in the appropriate Traits Repeating Section.
  • Verify your Point Summary now under your chosen format of GCA4 or GCS. Those that do not use either application should use the format they like best.

Suggestions

    Please note: I, Mike W, and MadCoder are not one of the original authors of this sheet. All we have done is to fix a number of small issues, changed some formatting, and implemented some suggested changes. The basic functionality of the sheet has remained the same.

    To report any Issues or a Suggestion, please use the Roll20 forum under Character Sheets & Compendium. I have created a thread named: [GURPS] - Sheet #1 - Thread 1 (that seems to be similar to the naming convention used by other sheets).

    https://app.roll20.net/forum/post/6616836/gurps-number-1-thread-1/

    In your post, please specify if it is an Issue or Suggestion with as much detail information as possible. Screen shots help a lot! I am just learning to work with HTML and CSS so I may not be able to do everything requested. I make no promises on how fast I may be able to implement a Fix or a Suggestion - so please be patient. -Thanks, Mike W.

    If there are others that are working on or wish to work on this sheet, lets coordinate using the Roll20 forum for now - perhaps later we can use GitHub.

Version:

Pull Request:

  • Combat Ranged tab. Updated the Range Calculator tool so you don't have to check the sheet option Use Ranged Attack Modifier Tool. If you click the Apply button for the Range Calculator tool, it will apply the modifiers and you will see them on the results table.
  • Traits Tab. Increased the size of the notes text boxes for Advantages, Disadvantages, and Racial Traits.
  • Active Defenses. When adding a brand new active defense, the Combat Reflexes bonus is now applied to the final base skill instead of adding a modifier bonus. Missed feature when converting Combat Reflexes in Version 2.7.8.
  • Active Defenses. Added the option to Dodge or Current Dodge as a link type.

Version: 2.7.8

Pull Request: 3/1/2022

  • Updated the text for tooltips, descriptions, and Add to Turn Order result.
  • Added some additional notes to Editable rules for damage types. NOTE: You can only see the new text if you start a new character.
  • Changed a number of labels for Weight to LBS for pounds, this is due to the new Use Metric Weight option.
  • Added new checkbox option for Use Metric Weights. The option can be selected for a specific character sheet or on the Default Sheet Options. If checked, labels will be changed to show KG and weight formulas updated as necessary.
    • I did a number of tests and tried to find all the locations for weights/pounds and update corresponding formulas, but if you find an error please let us know.
  • Size Modifier Costs for Strength, Hit Points, Lifting ST, and Striking ST was showing the wrong message if you didn't enter the minimum number of Character Points for the attribute. This has been fixed. Reported Niccy.
  • Combat Reflexes checkbox was updated to be more intuitive when updating the items from the custom Active Defenses table. Requested by Captain Joy.
    • When Combat Reflexes is checked, it will apply a bonus to the final skill level, avoiding confusion when updating the mod column and reason for mod description.
    • The first time your character sheet loads with this new version, it should convert custom active defenses to this new method. If you had combat reflexes checked, it will remove the +1 bonus to the mod column and remove the "+1 from combat reflexes" reason for mod description.
    • I would suggest unchecking/checking Combat Reflexes to make sure the conversion worked. You may also need to remove the "+1 from combat reflexes" since it does an exact match and if you modifed the description it might not have gotten removed.

Pull Request: 1/13/2022

  • Defense table. Combat Reflexes. If adding a brand new defense, Combat Reflexes will be added in, if checked.
  • Defense table. Combat Reflexes. Previously when Combat Reflexes was checked, the Reason for Mod was prepended with +1 from combat reflexes. . This has been updated to use [+1 from combat reflexes]. This will help show that this description was automatically added after checking Combat Reflexes. Please don't change this description, since it will be removed when unchecking Combat Reflexes, if it's changed, then the description will not get deleted.
    • If you have already checked Combat Reflexes, simply uncheck then check Combat Reflexes to update the repeating tables.
    • Also, be sure to check your final modifiers and description when checking/unchecking Combat Reflexes, especially if you manually added in Combat Reflexes or if you used the previous version where the description was prepended with +1 from combat reflexes.

Rolltemplate for Macros
Example Macro
&{template:macro} {{templateType=dnd5e}} {{sheetStyle=4}} {{roll=[[3d6]]}} {{target=[[13]]}} {{title=Drake}} {{subtitle=Attacks Orc}} {{Damage=[[1d6-1]] crush}} {{Location=[[3d6]]}} {{Note=Groin shots don't count}} {{desc=**Roll** HT-2 to avoid stun. If stunned roll HT each turn to recover.}}
  • templateType = basic | dnd5e | pathfinder.
  • sheetStyle = #. Matches the Sheet Style drop-down option on the character sheet.
    • 0 = Green
    • 1 = Blue
    • 2 = Beige
    • 3 = Gray
    • 4 = Classic White
    • 5 = Pastel Pink
    • 6 = Pastel Earth
    • 7 = Purple
    • 8 = Fabric
  • title = Main title
  • subtitle = Sub Title
  • desc = Description, full-width, placed at the bottom of the template.
  • roll = Macro for making a die roll.
  • target = Skill level for the die roll. If it exists in the macro, then it will appear to the right of the roll result.
  • All other properties will be automatically added to the template as key/value pairs. Key = Label, Value = displayed in second column.
    • Example: {{note=This is a test}}
    • note is the key and would populate the first column.
    • This is a test is the value would populate the second column.
    • Important The key would need to be a single word, no spaces.

Version: 2.5.2

Pull Request: 11/17/2020

  • Current Move Bug. Fix issue where current move wasn't updated when inventory total changes. Reported by Adam .
  • Combat Tab > Defense Sub-tab > Roll Modifier Tool. Add Defense Bonus modifier.

Pull Request: 10/27/2020

  • Combat tab > Defense. Increased the width of the original Hit Location table. Requested by PL M.
  • Combat tab > Damage sub-tab.
    • Add: Major wound field and tooltip.

Version: 2.5.0

Pull Request: 10/20/2020

Version: 2.4.0

Pull Request: 10/13/2020

  • Combat tab: Added sub tabs for Defense, Melee, Ranged, and Tools. Preliminary updates to improving Damage and Armor sections.
  • Combat tab -> Combat Tools: Remove redundant elevation direction, replaced by simple elevation field, if you're above the target, enter a positive number. If below the target, enter a negative number.

Version: 2.3.11

Pull Request: 9/22/2020

  • Roll Modifier Tools. First Iteration.
    • New Sheet Options under the section titled Skill Modifier Tool.
    • If checked, a custom modifier and action button will appear above a section of skills.
    • You can enter a modifier or click the action button to open a dialog box.
    • Max skill of 9 will limit your skill level to 9 or the modified skill that is less than 9.
    • Action button will open the Roll Modifiers box. You can enter own custom modifiers or check the ones that apply.
    • The modifiers can be helpful for new players and GMs.
    • There are a new set of campaign Game Settings to turn on the tools by default.
    • Roll Modifiers Dialog Box: Enter and/or select options. If ready, click the apply button. When make a roll, you will see the summary of modifiers on the roll results table.
  • Added new character sheet and campaign option to turn on/off minimum damage notes. Requested by The Fabulous Iron Chef.
  • Bug fix. Refactored how items linked to spells, skills, techniques, or attributes are updated. If you had multiple character sheets open, certain conditions would create empty rows for techniques, melee attacks, or range attacks.
  • Bug fix. Resolved a number javascript and html warning messages, which was only visible if viewing developer tools.

Skill Modifier Options

Display Roll Modifier Options in Header If checked, the options for No Modifier Prompt, Single Modifier Prompt and Extended Modifier Prompts will be displayed to the right of the character name above the tabs.
No Modifier Prompt Rolls will be made immediately with no prompt.
Single Modifier Prompt Ask for a bonus or penalty to be added to dice rolls.
This will not affect damage rolls.
Extended Modifier Prompts Instead of a single modifier, rolls will ask for a series of modifiers,
to remind you about potential bonuses/penalties.
This will not affect damage rolls.

Skill Modifier Tools

Use Skill Modifier Tool Displays a modifier text box, a button to open a tool to modify effective skill, and to check off Max skill of 9.
Use Technique Modifier Tool Displays a modifier text box, a button to open a tool to modify effective skill, and to check off Max skill of 9.
Use Defense Modifier Tool Displays a modifier text box, a button to open a tool to modify effective skill, and to check off Max skill of 9.
Use Melee Attack Modifier Tool Displays a modifier text box, a button to open a tool to modify effective skill, and to check off Max skill of 9.
Use Ranged Attack Modifier Tool Displays a modifier text box, a button to open a tool to modify effective skill, and to check off Max skill of 9.
Use Spell Modifier Tool Displays a modifier text box, a button to open a tool to modify effective skill, and to check off Max skill of 9.

Public or Private Rolls

Display Roll Options in Header If checked, the options for Public Rolls and Private Rolls will be displayed to the right of the character name above the tabs.
Display Custom Option in Header If checked, button name for Custom Rolls will be displayed to the right of the character name above the tabs.
Public Rolls All players will be able to see
your skill level, roll and results.
Private Skill Levels deprecated Only the GM will be able to see
your skill level, but all players
will see the result.
NOTE: This now behaves just like Private Rolls
Private Rolls Only the GM will see your skill
level and the result.
Custom Rolls Use this option to use a custom macro with the Roll Template.

Important: When entering the macro, be sure to add a space character to the end!

Add a Button Label to display a button in the header.

For example, the Private Rolls option adds /w gm to the beginning of the roll, which means whisper to GM.

Another example is adding a blind roll option, where only the GM sees the roll. This example uses the Blind Roll API script, see https://app.roll20.net/forum/permalink/5064809/.
Set Label = Blind Roll, set Macro = !broll
Button Name
Macro NOTE: In order to use this option, you will need an API script that can intercept the data for the roll and then send a message to the GM.

For an example, see the Blind Roll API script, https://app.roll20.net/forum/permalink/5064809/

Import Tool [BETA]

Initial version is designed for a one time import. Future iterations will allow re-import and adding GURPS Character Sheet (GCS).

GCA4 Import

  1. Export your character sheet to an XML file.
    • File > Export ... > Check Export XML File.
  2. Convert the XML file to json.
    • https://jsonformatter.org/xml-to-json
    • Alert! Open the file in an editor like Notepad or Notepad++. Opening in a browser may break the formatting of the json!
    • Initial testing worked with this sites. Alert if you use a different one make sure it doesn't create fields named __cdata
  3. Copy/Past the json data to the text box below.
  4. Press the [Import CGA] button
  5. Wait for the process to complete.
  6. Review the sheet and notify the Forum of any errors or feature requests.

JSON DATA

Import Notes
Import notes into Bio\Misc fields and into Notes textboxes for repeating tables.

Alert

Since the JSON data is large, please only press the button once. Then wait for the Processing... message to show. It might take more than 5 to 10 seconds to run, depending on your processing power. If the Processing... doesn't disappear after 20 seconds or so, then something probably broke during the import.

Your feedback is most welcomed! See link below.
